result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Darryl C Woodard in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Darryl C Woodard in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Pursuant to guilty pleas on cases 15CM1638 and 15CM1810, and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered case dismissed and read-in for sentencing.

Defendant Darryl C Woodard in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Darryl C Woodard in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a bail/bond hearing. State's motion for joinder of 15CM1810, 15CM1638, 15CM1356 & 14CM3789 for trial. All matters set for Jury Trial on 8/3/2015 at 8:30 AM. Court vacated Final Pretrial date, parties no longer wish to hold hearing. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Attorney Alexis Liggins for Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Darryl C Woodard not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced.  Case set for a Bail/Bond Hearing, defense requested case be adjourned for a bail/bond hearing with new pending case set before intake court to allow all matters to be addressed together. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Darryl C Woodard in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Darryl C Woodard in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza previously in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23
Case set for a Bail/Bond Hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited, but held subject to a hearing.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case set for Bail/Bond Hearing in branch 23.

Defendant Darryl C Woodard in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July, 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM021103  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/21/2015

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with APRIL B-W., HER RESIDENCE OR 3915 N 40TH (SCENE).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Darryl C Woodard in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Darryl C Woodard in custody.  Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  CASE RETABBED TO FOLLOW PENDING CASE.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
